meanings.definition: To move or transfer (something) from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: I will transplant the flowers from the garden to the pot.
meanings.sent2: The farmer decided to transplant the tree to a sunnier spot.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to transplant the acorn to a different tree.
meanings.sent4: She wanted to transplant her love for gardening into her children.
meanings.sent5: The idea of transplanting the old tradition into modern times excited the community.

meanings.definition: A surgical procedure in which an organ or tissue is removed from one part of the body and placed in another.
meanings.sent1: The doctor performed a successful transplant on the patient's heart.
meanings.sent2: She needed a kidney transplant to improve her health.
meanings.sent3: The hospital had a special room for recovering transplant patients.
meanings.sent4: The organ transplant saved his life and gave him a second chance.
meanings.sent5: The community raised funds to support those in need of organ transplants.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that has been moved or transferred from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The new student was a transplant from a different city.
meanings.sent2: The rare flower was a transplant from a tropical region.
meanings.sent3: The cat, a transplant from the shelter, quickly adapted to its new home.
meanings.sent4: The transplant of ideas from different cultures enriched the community.
meanings.sent5: The transplant of the old clock brought new life to the room.
